result.execSummary:
The defendant Rayshon Andrew Wheaton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample. 
Pay all costs, surcharges and assessments, including the DNA surcharges to be paid from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC , remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pa will result in a civil judgment.
*Court sets restitution at zero.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program AND the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 18 months.
concurrent to 21CF4101 and 22CF562, credit for 311 DAYS time served.

superMiscConds.notes: Not to be present where firearms are present in any vehicle. No possession of illegal drugs.

supervisions.notes: Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rayshon Andrew Wheaton

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: Letter from defendant re:  amending JOC.  (Rayshon A. Wheaton - #517378, Dodge Correctional Institution, PO Box 700, Waupun WI 53963-0700).

Defendant Rayshon Andrew Wheaton in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Rayshon Andrew Wheaton in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 2: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 6 YEARS, concurrent to 21CF4101 and 22CF562, credit for 311 DAYS time served. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 3 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
- Not to be present where firearms are present in any vehicle.
- No possession of illegal drugs. 

- Pay all costs, surcharges and assessments, including the DNA surcharges to be paid from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 


*Court sets restitution at zero.
*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program AND the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 18 months. 
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, 
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Rayshon Andrew Wheaton in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Rayshon Andrew Wheaton in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement. 

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1 941.29(1m)(a) Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony.  

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defendant is advised is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  
Defendant is advised unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  

Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 4 on 8/1/22 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have a global resolution and are requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 04.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Rayshon Andrew Wheaton not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requests more time for review. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Rayshon Andrew Wheaton in court with Attorney Michael B Plaisted; both appear by video.  Defendant Rayshon Andrew Wheaton in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 19CF1169. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective D. Gaglione. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 4.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
States witness was on an active scene and unable to appear. Detective M. Ball contacted the Court by telephone with this information.

Defendant Rayshon Andrew Wheaton in court with Attorney Michael B Plaisted; both appear by video.  Defendant Rayshon Andrew Wheaton in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Rayshon Andrew Wheaton not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Pretrial Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Rayshon Andrew Wheaton in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Rayshon Andrew Wheaton in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/18/22 @ 2:30p
